com.markussecundus.forms.events

Interface EventDelegate<Args>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EventListener<Args>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IEventDelegate

    public interface EventDelegate<Args>
extends EventListener<Args>
    An EventListener that encapsulates a list of listeners.
    Author:
    MarkusSecundus
    See Also:
    IEventDelegate, EventListener, EventListenerX

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  EventDelegate.ApplyOnParentDelegate
      If it is thrown from a listener, the delegate catches it and performs its method exec on itself.
      static class  EventDelegate.Priorities
      Reference to ListenerPriorities visible directly inside EventDelegate for more clarity.
      static interface  EventDelegate.ReturnValuePolicy
      Determines what return value the delegate will have depending on the return value of its elements.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static EventDelegate.ReturnValuePolicy DEFAULT_RET_VAL_POLICY
      Default value of EventDelegate.ReturnValuePolicy property in every implementation of EventDelegate if it isn't stated otherwise.
      static EventDelegate.ApplyOnParentDelegate DELETE_SELF
      Listener that is currently being executed is to be erased, after which the execution of the rest of listeners should continue as if the erased listener returned true.
      static EventDelegate.ApplyOnParentDelegate DELETE_SELF_AND_ABORT
      Listener that is currently being executed is to be erased, after which the execution of the delegate should be suspended as if the erased listener returned false.

      • DELETE_SELF

        static final EventDelegate.ApplyOnParentDelegate DELETE_SELF
        Listener that is currently being executed is to be erased, after which the execution of the rest of listeners should continue as if the erased listener returned true.
        See Also:
        EventDelegate.ApplyOnParentDelegate

      • DELETE_SELF_AND_ABORT

        static final EventDelegate.ApplyOnParentDelegate DELETE_SELF_AND_ABORT
        Listener that is currently being executed is to be erased, after which the execution of the delegate should be suspended as if the erased listener returned false.
        See Also:
        EventDelegate.ApplyOnParentDelegate

    • Method Detail

      • make

        static <T> EventDelegate<T> make()
        Returns a new instance of the canonical implementation of this interface.
        Returns:
        New instance of cannonical implementation of EventDelegate

      • getListeners

        java.util.List<EventListener<? super Args>> getListeners(java.lang.Integer priority)
        List containing all listeners with the desired priority. Its contents can be added or modified in any possible way.

        When the delegate gets executed, all the listeners present inside get executed in order determined firstly by their priority - delegates with the same priority are ordered by their position in this list. (the higher the priority and the lower the index, the earlier the listener gets executed)

        Returns:
        List of listeners with the desired priority

      • getUserListeners

        default java.util.List<EventListener<? super Args>> getUserListeners()
        List containing all userland listeners. Its contents can be added or modified in any possible way.

        When the delegate gets executed, all the listeners present inside get executed in order determined firstly by their priority - delegates with the same priority are ordered by their position in this list. (the higher the priority and the lower the index, the earlier the listener gets executed)

        Equivalent to getListeners(ListenerPriorities.USER)

        Returns:
        List of userland listeners

      • _getUtilListeners

        default java.util.List<EventListener<? super Args>> _getUtilListeners()
        List containing all basic utility listeners that get executed before the userland ones. Its contents can be added or modified in any possible way. Serves rather as a convenience shortcut for use by the writer of the library and is not intended for use by an ordinary user, unless he knows what he is doing.

        When the delegate gets executed, all the listeners present inside get executed in order determined firstly by their priority - delegates with the same priority are ordered by their position in this list. (the higher the priority and the lower the index, the earlier the listener gets executed)

        Equivalent to getListeners(ListenerPriorities.PRE_UTIL)

        Returns:
        List of utility listeners

      • _getPostUtilListeners

        default java.util.List<EventListener<? super Args>> _getPostUtilListeners()
        List containing all basic utility listeners that get executed after the userland ones. Its contents can be added or modified in any possible way. Serves rather as a convenience shortcut for use by the writer of the library and is not intended for use by an ordinary user, unless he knows what he is doing.

        When the delegate gets executed, all the listeners present inside get executed in order determined firstly by their priority - delegates with the same priority are ordered by their position in this list. (the higher the priority and the lower the index, the earlier the listener gets executed)

        Equivalent to getListeners(ListenerPriorities.POST_UTIL)

        Returns:
        List of utility listeners

      • removeListener

        boolean removeListener(EventListener<?> list)
        Removes the desired listener if it resides anywhere in the delegate, no matter what its priority is.
        Returns:
        true if the specified listener was removed succesfully

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears the whole delegate - removes completely all of its listeners, including the utility ones, which you probably don't want to remove.

        For removal of only userland listeners, use getUserListeners().clear() instead.

      • returnValuePolicy

        Property<EventDelegate.ReturnValuePolicy> returnValuePolicy()
        Determines what return value the delegate will have depending on the return value of its elements.
        Returns:
        Property determining what return value the delegate will have depending on the return value of its elements.
        See Also:
        EventDelegate.ReturnValuePolicy

      • getReturnValuePolicy

        default EventDelegate.ReturnValuePolicy getReturnValuePolicy()
        Convenience shortcut for returnValuePolicy().get().
        Returns:
        Convenience shortcut for returnValuePolicy().get().

      • setReturnValuePolicy

        default EventDelegate.ReturnValuePolicy setReturnValuePolicy(EventDelegate.ReturnValuePolicy pol)
        Convenience shortcut for returnValuePolicy().set(pol).
        Parameters:
        pol - new value for the returnValuePolicy property
        Returns:
        Convenience shortcut for returnValuePolicy().set(pol).

      • exec

        boolean exec(Args e)
        Executes all the listeners encapsulated by this delegate, one by one in order determined first by their priority (higher is first) and then by their position in the getListeners() list (lower index is first).

        If one of the listeners returns false the execution of the delegate gets aborted. The return value is determined by the returnValuePolicy property { -see EventDelegate.ReturnValuePolicy}.
        Specified by:
        exec in interface EventListener<Args>
        Parameters:
        e - arguments to be passed to the listeners
        Returns:
        sign whether there is sense in continuing with subsequent operations; depends on the returnValuePolicy property

      • add

        default void add(EventListenerX<? super Args> list)
        Adds the desired EventListenerX instance to the end of the list of userspace listeners.

        Serves only for better convenience when writing lambdas (so that the user doesn't have to explicitly return true everywhere).
        Parameters:
        list - listener to be added into this delegate
